basic.floral_language:
Sedum corynephyllum
Floriography: cute, optimistic, warm
Sedum corynephyllum has thick, fleshy, and oval gray-green leaves with small top and large bottom, just the opposite with Sedum pachyphyllum leaf, smooth surface. Leaves generally difficult to change, when large temperature difference between day and night and very ample sunshine, the leaves will turn orange to pink.
Yachiyo like much sun, but in summer into hibernation, to be put in the scattered light at conservation. Mostly in spring bloom, yellow flowers
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, often flowers in spring, yellow flowers
basic.color: Leaf color gray green, with full sunlight leaf tips turning to orange to light red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, and resistant to half shade, short period of dormancy in summer, use half shade for better care
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 7-10 days, reduce water in dormancy
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, dilute fertilizers following instructions,  in early summer, spring and autumn apply fertilizers once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
